symposium.name: 9th Working Formal Methods Symposium
symposium.description: The Working Formal Methods Symposium (FROM) aims to bring together researchers and practitioners working on formal methods by contributing new theoretical results, methods, techniques, and frameworks, and/or by creating or using software tools that apply theoretical contributions. The program includes invited lectures and regular contributions.

invited_speakers.name: Jérôme Leroux
invited_speakers.affiliation: Laboratoire Bordelais de Recherche en Informatique (LaBRI)

invited_speakers.name: Rupak Majumdar
invited_speakers.affiliation: Max Planck Institute for Software Systems and Automated Reasoning Group, Amazon Web Services

organizers: Verimag, CNRS, University of Grenoble Alpes
Faculty of Computer Science, Alexandru Ioan Cuza University of Iași

submission_details.requirements: Papers of up to 16 pages prepared according to the EPTCS template must be submitted electronically using the EasyChair submission system. Research papers must contain original research results not submitted or published elsewhere.

extended_version.journal: Journal of Logical and Algebraic Methods in Programming
extended_version.approval: Subject to formal approval by Elsevier.

extended_abstract.content: Authors wishing to present work in progress or survey previous research are invited to submit.

submission_details.review_process: Papers will be reviewed and selected based on scientific merit and relevance.
